alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 8:06PM EDT until August 08 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Delaware and Sullivan. In northeast Pennsylvania, Susquehanna and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Callicoon, Forest City, Union Dale, Equinunk, Rutledgedale, Stalker, Hankins, Peabrook, Pleasant Mount, Fremont, Rileyville, Lookout, Lake Como, Lakewood, Abrahamsville, Aldenville, Orson, Browndale, Uniondale and North Branch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
